Package com.seagullsw.appinterface.client

This package supports the creation of objects representing client connections to an Application Interface Server (AIS).

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AppInterfaceConnection
    The AppInterfaceConnection interface represents a single client connection to the Application Interface Server.
    AppInterfaceConnectionBuilder
    Specifies various manners of building AppInterfaceConnections.
    ClientFunctionDataConverter
    Defines methods for converting the data values in Request objects from Java objects to an external representation (such as Strings), and in Response objects from such an external representation back to Java objects.
    MessageProcessor<T>
    Hook for optional processing of messages before they are sent and/or received by the client framework.
    RequestMarshaller<T extends com.seagullsw.appinterface.model.data.IRequestElementProxy>
    Hook for optional processing of requests before they are sent by the client framework.
    ResponseUnmarshaller
    Hook for optional processing of responses before they are consumed by the client framework.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AppInterfaceConnectionFactory
    The "factory" class AppInterfaceConnectionFactory is non-instantiable, but provides static methods for the creation of AppInterfaceConnectionobjects representing client connections to the Application Interface Server using either socket- or HTTP-based communication protocols.
    BasicAppInterfaceConnection
    This base abstract class may be extended to accommodate a variety of client-server communication protocols, such as sockets or HTTP.
    CicsEngineAppInterfaceConnection
    This is an AppInterfaceConnection that sends directly to the LegaSuite CICS Engine (LCE) via HTTP.
    ClientFunctionDataConverterAdapter
    A default NOOP implementation of ClientFunctionDataConverter.
    HTTPAppInterfaceConnection
    Provides AIS HTTP client communication.
    SocketAppInterfaceConnection
    Communicates to the AIS via a socket.
    SslAppInterfaceConnection
    Provides AIS SSL socket client communication.
    TextAppInterfaceConnection
    Concrete subclasses use text, usually XML, as the encoding for communication with an AIS.

Package com.seagullsw.appinterface.client Description

This package supports the creation of objects representing client connections to an Application Interface Server (AIS). Connection objects, which implement the AppInterfaceConnection interface, currently can be instantiated in two flavors that employ, respectively, either socket-based or HTTP-based communication protocols: SocketAppInterfaceConnection and HTTPAppInterfaceConnection.  Both of these concrete classes extend a base abstract superclass, BasicAppInterfaceConnection.  A primary use of connections is made by Java command beans (subclasses of AppInterfaceCommand), which delegate to them the details of communication with the AIS, including server session management, opening/closing of communication paths, XML parsing of interface function invocation requests and responses, and the forwarding of function execution calls themselves.

Connection objects of the various types are created, and their properties configured (such as IP address, port number), by means of static method calls to the "factory" class AppInterfaceConnectionFactory, for example AppInterfaceConnectionFactory.createDefaultConnection(), AppInterfaceConnectionFactory.createSocketConnection(String,int), or AppInterfaceConnectionFactory.createHTTPConnection(String).

For the purposes of Java client programs, AppInterfaceConnection objects are most typically created in the context of instantiating a Java command bean, that is, an extension of the abstract superclass AppInterfaceCommand.  Command beans are generated automatically, together with their corresponding interface function definitions, by the Interface Function Publisher, which can be invoked from the Interface Definition Tool's "Publish" menu or toolbar button.  If a command bean is instantiated with the no-argument constructor overriding AppInterfaceCommand, then the bean is installed with a default socket connection to an Application Interface Server on the local machine (IP address "localhost") and listening at a default system-defined port.  Alternatively, a command bean may be instantiated using the one-argument constructor overriding AppInterfaceCommand.AppInterfaceCommand(AppInterfaceConnection), in which case the bean is installed with a connection of the desired type, communicating with an AIS at a user-specified (remote) IP address and port number, that was explicitly created using one of the AppInterfaceConnectionFactory static factory methods referred to above.
